page.title: 18FARM WORKERS
page.content: An elderly partly retired farmworker living in a rented cottage on his employer's land sees the change from labour intensive to machine intensive as making life easier for the farmer. Fork lift trucks dispense with the need for a man to hump 2cwt sacks and tractors replace the 6 or 8 horses with 9 men still in use in the 1940's. Working days are shorter by at least 3 hours and pay is an improvment on Â£3.17.6 for a fortnight in the 1930's. During WORLD WAR II Italian prisoners picked potatoes.Until recently there was crop rotation and mixed farming. This worker was very concerned at the amount of sprays,artifical fertilizers used for high yields and feared for the future of the soil as do many scientists today.He enjoys managing woods for pheasants and shoots rabbits to sell.
